intro: Phaeocephalum patulum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access moisture from deep within the soil. The yellow flowers bloom in late spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
